definition: next in sequence/second/the second (day, time etc)/secondary/vice-/sub-/infra-/inferior quality/substandard/order/sequence/hypo- (chemistry)/classifier for enumerated events: time

sentences.english: And, within a column, it decreases down a column.
sentences.chinese: 而且在一列内，它逐次递减。

sentences.english: The iteration method is applied to seek the approximate solution of the hybrid system.
sentences.chinese: 用逐次近似法寻求混合系统的近似解。

sentences.english: Try to gradually extend the period of time between cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 试着逐次延长每次吸烟的间隔时间。

sentences.english: It starts from your daily life and needs to be approached to step by step.
sentences.chinese: 那是一步一步逐次去做，从自己的日常生活开始的。

sentences.english: Using the successive over-relaxation method, the difference values of the torsion stress function are determined.
sentences.chinese: 用逐次超松驰迭代法求出了扭转应力函数差分值。

sentences.english: Once the barrier is breached, losses are incurred on a one-for-one basis.
sentences.chinese: 一旦突破了这个关口，损失是逐次计算的。

sentences.english: The water initially filled river channels in the north before traveling southward.
sentences.chinese: 水流由北向南逐次前进，首先滋润了北方的河道。

sentences.english: These capacitors form binary weight array in successive approximation architecture.
sentences.chinese: 这些电容在逐次逼近结构中构成二进制权阵列。

definition: to increase by degrees/in increasing order/incremental/progressive
to break up the whole into pieces (idiom); dealing with things one by one/divide and conquer
to do sth in batches or groups
and so on/in a similar fashion
